New Records: First lead-flipping postseason grand slam in the history of the Mets franchise
Only the second lead-flipping slam, in the sixth inning or later, in a game that clinched a series for their team, in the history of postseason baseball
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's grand slam in the 6th inning provided all four runs in a 4-1 Mets win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets ended a 63-season drought of hitting a lead-flipping late-inning grand slam in a regular-season game
Others: The Mets clinched a spot in the NLCS
